info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL STILLWATER AND CENTRAL CARBON COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM MDT... At 559 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Absarokee, or 13 miles northwest of Red Lodge, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bridger, Joliet, Fromberg, Cooney Reservoir State Park, Edgar, Rockvale, Boyd, Roberts, Luther, and Fox. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
